TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
When you get some time, can you post all of this stuff when you feel that it's really polished and share-worthy? Especially the Tantares-skinned fairings? I really like the Polaris-skinned crew tanks! The Angara .crafts could really keep the Angara fans off Beale's back for a while.

I also agree on the Progress. I think linkage between the OM and the CM should be a little more contiguous, and gentle.

Looks great all around though @Beale. Please take some time off and get your IRL work done. Don't let people push you around. Get done what you need to do.

I'll check with Beale about posting retextures and such, because I'm mucking around with the Soyuz textures as well, trying to get a Soyuz-TMA kind of look.

The fairings are good to go already, plus I've got a full batch of varying shapes that I'll show too.

Regarding Angara, I'm using custom Tweakscale configs, and I may have used some part clipping on the upper stages, but I'll release what I can for you all! In the meantime I can say this: The URM-1 core is the long 2.5m tank from ABLaunchers, rescaled to 1.875m, the engine is the RS-68 analogue from Kerbal Stock Launcher Overhaul, and URM-2 is a 2.5m tank from Tantares LV's Proton third stage, with a scaled-down version copied and clipped inside, and the Soyuz second stage engine attached to that. KVTK is the Proton tank with 2 Aerojet Kerbodyne ICPS tanks clipped inside (I mucked around with the scaling so I'll post some config edits if people are interested), and the other 2.5m engine from KSLO on the bottom. It'll take a little while to ensure I've got everything covered for people to use the stuff right out of the box.

Would anyone be interested in making a FSTextureSwitch2 MM patch for the parts I retexture?

Sure thing!

Open the texture in Photoshop, change to edit the Alpha layer.

The Alpha layer controls "shiny-ness" so, if you make the Alpha layer black, or very dark grey, you will reduce the amount of shine.

http://puu.sh/h1kU3/162fc7eb03.jpg

It worked, thanks!

Looks a little bit cartoony. I was very amused and, I suppose, will keep it that way.

Also considering new Proton - yeah, please keep the old parts too. I like to use Hamal core with Almach engine, and also like to have station crew&supply vehicle (Tantares crew, Hamal orbital modules) and interorbital transport vehicle (Hamal core, Tantares orbital modules).

Edited April 5, 2015 by nothingSpecial

Good idea, it might reduce confusion between the Progress's Orbital Module and the Soyuz's Orbital Module.

Nah! I'll be keeping existing parts, only adding more. So the confusion will remain (What's not to love?).

I've settled more or less on the "Science Return" probe shape.

It's a painfully basic mesh, but I'll hopefully bring out a bit of personality in the texture.

Beyond this there will be the combined, expendable, OM & CM Progress.

What have I done...

http://i.imgur.com/cAX30Z3.jpg

I had to fight myself to avoid putting this on a plane and bomb KSC with it.

http://i.imgur.com/CAjBBcf.png

I bet no one ever thought of weaponizing Tantares like this.

You're doing a good job of sabotaging our peaceful space program

Although I have to admit that's quite a creative use of it!

What you can do is use TweakScale to get a 1.875m version of the Soyuz service module. You have to add a 1.875m scale to stack, then ensure that the MM config for Tantares (included with TweakScale) has a section for the service module. It'll save you from having to add another part.

Code for SM in Tantares Tweakscale config

@PART[Tantares_Engine_A] // TST Orbital Manouvering System
{
	MODULE
	{
		name = TweakScale
		type = stack
		defaultScale = 1.25
	}
}

Code to add 1.875m scale to stack scaletype in TweakScale (edit the defaultscales.cfg file)

SCALETYPE
{
    name = stack
    freeScale = false
    scaleFactors = 0.625, 1.25, [U][B]1.875[/B][/U], 2.5, 3.75, 5.0, 6.25, 7.5
    scaleNames = 62.5cm, 1.25m, [U][B]1.875m[/B][/U], 2.5m, 3.75m, 5m, 6.25m, 7.5m
    defaultScale = 1.25

	ATTACHNODES
	{
		base = 1
		top = Stack:1
		top01 = Stack:1
		top02 = Stack:1
		top03 = Stack:1
		bottom = Stack:1
		bottom01 = Stack:1
		bottom02 = Stack:1
		bottom03 = Stack:1
		bottom04 = Stack:1
	}
}

In other news...

I used the .psd files Beale linked in his sig to make a retexture of two Salyut core parts to look more like Polaris.http://i.imgur.com/6DwGSRW.png

And I spent way too much time playing around with Kronal Vessel Viewer to showcase my Angara build (uses ABLaunchers parts as well).

http://i.imgur.com/8twInmD.jpg

Wow!

Really though!

You've taken the task of making an Angara/PPTS into your own hands and done a fantastic job.

Makes me very inspired to get working on it!

Just glancing through the pages and the downloads, where is the klipper parts located? and is there a craft file for it...

Thanks for any help and for a great set of mods....

Kliper is not finished yet, but you can get a Beta version here.

It's just the capsule and is very very unstable, but enjoy!

No craft file, but the capsule alone will glide. The rest of it is your imagination.

@Beale. Please take some time off and get your IRL work done. Don't let people push you around. Get done what you need to do.

No worries eh.

If I don't spare some time to do this I enjoy, I'll go crazy.

It worked, thanks!

Looks a little bit cartoony. I was very amused and, I suppose, will keep it that way.

Also considering new Proton - yeah, please keep the old parts too. I like to use Hamal core with Almach engine, and also like to have station crew&supply vehicle (Tantares crew, Hamal orbital modules) and interorbital transport vehicle (Hamal core, Tantares orbital modules).

I think a "little" shine is good, but I do go overboard occasionally!

Old parts will stay

KIS config has a small error. The section for the Pollux list the part as "Pollux_Orbital_A" and should be "Pollux_Control_A".

Edit - Capella may have same type of error. Not sure on this one though. KIS config lists "Capella_Orbital_A" but parts lists shows "_Capella_Control_A.cfg" with a part name of "Capella_Control_A". Is the leading underscore intentional on the .cfg file?

Edited April 5, 2015 by Gristle

KIS config has a small error. The section for the Pollux list the part as "Pollux_Orbital_A" and should be "Pollux_Control_A".

Edit - Capella may have same type of error. Not sure on this one though. KIS config lists "Capella_Orbital_A" but parts lists shows "_Capella_Control_A.cfg" with a part name of "Capella_Control_A". Is the leading underscore intentional on the .cfg file?

I'll look to fix, thanks for finding.

Underscore intentional, groups configs alphabetically at top of folder.

Hi Beale, I play a lot with your tantares semiorka, but there is one thing I miss the fins on the first stage, can you help me ? Thank you for being close to your community, I really appreciate the attention you are giving to all our requests . Well, this community is amazing !

Hi Beale, I play a lot with your tantares semiorka, but there is one thing I miss the fins on the first stage, can you help me ? Thank you for being close to your community, I really appreciate the attention you are giving to all our requests . Well, this community is amazing !

I used the small control surfaces to make little fins. They don't do anything, don't look as accurate as I would like, and shift the CoM of the boosters enough so that the Korolev Cross is ruined, but they are tolerable

They're visible on this picture, but they are quite hard to see. I'll see if I can get a better photo up later

I used the small control surfaces to make little fins. They don't do anything, don't look as accurate as I would like, and shift the CoM of the boosters enough so that the Korolev Cross is ruined, but they are tolerable

I currently use turbonisu's triangle structural panel making the thing too big and absurd, still funny !

Also, I locked the gimbal of the engines and placed " waykeepers " as vernier engines, just like in the real semiorka, and used the gravioli as the red thingy ( maybe a fire extinguisher ? )

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The R-7 is from far, my favourite rocket, I'm trying to make it as realistic as possible but when decoupling ( I use multiple sets of decouplers ) the decouplers collide and explode, nothing to worry about, michael bay approved.

For fins, I may get around to it some-time, but like the gridded N-1 steerings fins, not a priority.

Alright, my last bit of work for the evening! Some small tweaks to the fabric texture and alpha channel, making it "pop" a bit more. Since the aesthetics will differ from your standard Tantares, I'll include some part configs so that you can keep your gray ones and have the fancy new one.

Also to be included: Polaris-style retexture of some MIR parts, and Procedural Fairings textures and shapes to use with this pack!

Yay, good luck with the Roach! Our RL solid rockets failed with success rate of 2 out of 11.

Mostly because fuel for rocket models is hard to buy in Russia, since government is going paranoid on all flammable materials, we have to make powder by our own efforts.

Honestly, the other day my boyfriend broke up with me. So as you can imagine, I've been really depressed. But seeing the updates and all of the recognition you're getting for this mod still manages to put a smile on my face every time. (I have no life anymore. It's just KSP now.)

I'm sorry for your loss and feel you. My gf broke up with me half a year ago and since then I have no life too. Hope we will make you feel even better with more stuff!

Seeing all these nice new textures for the Soyuz has anyone done a cfg so we can use Firespitter to toggle between them?

Seeing all these nice new textures for the Soyuz has anyone done a cfg so we can use Firespitter to toggle between them?

I've been attempting to make one, but no dice so far.

EDIT: Redid the alpha channel for the Tantares TMA textures. Now it really looks like thermal fabric. In light it shouldn't be totally flat and nonreflective, and all the imperfections and texturing in the thermal fabric is apparent.

I'm looking into my fairing textures, and I might redo them in tga so they have alpha channels as well, and look better in the light. But that's a lower priority right now; I'm polishing TMA, and I'm also mucking about with the Mir textures, trying to get some color into the Mir Core Module (I stopped working on the Polaris-style texture, since I don't think it looks very good; but it's more or less finished and I'll release it this week). Looking at IRL Mir and Zarya for inspiration.

What mods did you use (other than TweakScale ((for rescaling ABLaunchers 2.5 tank)), Tantares, and TantaresLV and ((for KVTK)) Aerojet Kerbodyne?)

Also pls I am drooling those grey fairings pls pls put iy up as a download....

Cheers, flamerboy67664/SpaceEagle

I custom-rescaled the Aerojet Kerbodyne ICPS lower tank for KVTK, so that's a more or less custom part. I also used the KSLO 2.5m engines, plus our dear friend TweakScale to get 1.875m sizing. Procedural Fairings for the interstage and payload fairing, Ven's Stock Revamp (I think) for radial reaction wheels I clipped inside the tanks, and that's it, I believe. The Space Shuttle Engines pack supplied the Angara 7.2 core engine (it's the straight SSME, standing in for the RD-0120).

Regarding releasing, cool yer jets! I'm very finicky with my textures so I'll make tons of small tweaks over a period of time. I'm considering revamping the PF textures entirely to add an alpha channel and make them look even nicer, but barring that you can expect a release of TMA, the textures and fairing shapes, and maybe some more Mir stuff by the end of this week.

Edited April 6, 2015 by planeguy868
